column4: Does anyone know how long it takes to do a file system check on 2 tarabytes?
quite some time :~~)
Would you say half hour or so?

it takes about 30mins todo my 300gb drive, so quite alot longer but it will depend on the data on the drive and the way its organised i guess. i dont think it can be predicted. its a case of suck it and see ;o
Well, in this case we don't have choice. We did a reboot on a server and it started the file system check on boot. I think we hit our "days" limit.
its been fscking for 24hrs?
No!
It's only been going for about 15 minutes or so.
ah yes i see. i hope it dosen't take too long :~)
I gues I need to call the person in front of the server and let them know. I'm just the remote addmin.
yea. it might be wise to get a kvm hooked up so you can monitor it.
I was told a monitor was pluged in but I'm not sure if they can see the bottem of the screen. The resolution might be set wrong.
ah. i've gotta go get some munch. good luck (Y)
Thanks. We will need all the luck we can get
fyi you can use the tunefs tools to change the number of days that a disk requires a check and disable it all together
Should it be disabled?
i disable it on all my servers and make a point to run it once a month at a time thats convinient and isn't disrupting the services on the box
Sounds like I need to do something like that. Doesn't this need to be done at boot or when the file systems arn't mounted
it does yea but you can tell it to fsck on the next boot
I should look into this. some of the stuff I'm finding on google are saying "days". This is starting to look bad.
for something that big i wouldn't be surprised, but it really depends on too many factors to predict like the speed of the discs, data on them, number of errors and such forth
It's a 3ware SATA RAID setup. The os is about 600gig RAID 5. The data RAID is 1.4T's on RAID 10
at least they are fast disks so it shouldn't take a day heh :)
We are hoping.
